sample.responseData: CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN "TRUE" ELSE "FALSE" END TRUE
sample.samplerData: [Select Statement] SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN "TRUE" ELSE "FALSE" END FROM book_info

sample.responseData: CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN "TRUE" ELSE "FALSE" END TRUE
sample.samplerData: [Select Statement] SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN "TRUE" ELSE "FALSE" END FROM flowers_for_algernon

sample.lb: Check sum words with capital letters and words in lowercase is equal to number of words in text
sample.responseData: CASE WHEN words_with_capital_letters + words_in_lowercase == number_of_words THEN "TRUE" ELSE "FALSE" END TRUE
sample.samplerData: [Select Statement] SELECT CASE WHEN words_with_capital_letters + words_in_lowercase == number_of_words THEN "TRUE" ELSE "FALSE" END FROM book_info WHERE book_name = "Flowers for Algernon"

sample.lb: Check count of all words in Flowers for Algernon book between 'book_info' and 'flowers_for_algernon' tables
sample.responseData: CASE WHEN (SELECT number_of_words FROM book_info WHERE book_name = "Flowers for Algernon") == (SELECT SUM(count) FROM flowers_for_algernon) THEN "TRUE" ELSE "FALSE" END TRUE
sample.samplerData: [Select Statement] SELECT CASE WHEN (SELECT number_of_words FROM book_info WHERE book_name = "Flowers for Algernon") == (SELECT SUM(count) FROM flowers_for_algernon) THEN "TRUE" ELSE "FALSE" END

sample.lb: Check count of all words with capital letter in Flowers for Algernon book between 'book_info' and 'flowers_for_algernon' tables
sample.responseData: CASE WHEN (SELECT words_with_capital_letters FROM book_info WHERE book_name = "Flowers for Algernon") == (SELECT SUM(count_uppercase) FROM flowers_for_algernon) THEN "TRUE" ELSE "FALSE" END TRUE
sample.samplerData: [Select Statement] SELECT CASE WHEN (SELECT words_with_capital_letters FROM book_info WHERE book_name = "Flowers for Algernon") == (SELECT SUM(count_uppercase) FROM flowers_for_algernon) THEN "TRUE" ELSE "FALSE" END
